eu.cqse.check.abap

Class OpenSqlWriteStatement

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.abap.OpenSqlWriteStatement

  • public abstract class OpenSqlWriteStatement
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a SQL-like ABAP statement that modifies database table's contents. This offers more detailed analysis, e.g. finding out whether the targeted table is in the standard namespace.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ShallowEntity entity
      An entity representing an OpenSQL statement directly or an entity representing a macro which contains an OpenSQL statement.
      protected java.util.List<IToken> tokens
      The tokens that constitute the statement.
      protected ITypeResolution typeResolution
      Type resolution of OpenSQL statement.

    • Field Detail

      • tokens

        protected java.util.List<IToken> tokens
        The tokens that constitute the statement.

      • entity

        protected ShallowEntity entity
        An entity representing an OpenSQL statement directly or an entity representing a macro which contains an OpenSQL statement.

        protected ITypeResolution typeResolution
        Type resolution of OpenSQL statement.

    • Method Detail

      • getTableTokenIndex

        protected int getTableTokenIndex()
        Determines the token index at which the table name starts. Returns 1 by default.

      • hasSureITabSyntax

        protected abstract boolean hasSureITabSyntax()
        Checks whether the statement is targeted at an internal table. Returns true if it is sure from the statement syntax alone that an iTab is targeted.

      • targetsInternalTable

        public boolean targetsInternalTable()
        Checks whether the target table of the statement is a variable.

      • getStatementStartToken

        public IToken getStatementStartToken()
        Gets the statement start token, e.g. INSERT.

      • getTableName

        public java.lang.String getTableName()
        Returns the name of the targeted table in upper case.

      • getTableNameToken

        public IToken getTableNameToken()
        Returns the IToken holding the table name

      • targetsStandardDatabaseTable

        public boolean targetsStandardDatabaseTable()
        Checks whether the statement targets a standard database table, i.e. a database table from an SAP namespace. Uses the ITypeResolution to distinguish local variables from standard tables.

      • create

        public static OpenSqlWriteStatement create(ShallowEntity entity,
                                           java.util.List<IToken> tokens,
                                           ITypeResolution typeResolution)
        Factory method. tokens must be one of INSERT, MODIFY, UPDATE, DELETE. Returns null if passed token list is not an OpenSQL statement targeting a database table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - In case the statement has an unsupported type.
